definition: not giving any reason to have hope or expect anything good
cold and unpleasant
exposed, empty, or with no pleasant features
thin threads from a plant, also called jute, used for making rope and rough cloth
a large bag made from rough material and used to store flour, potatoes, etc.
a type of rice with long grains and a pleasant taste
the part of a monk’s or priest’s head that the hair has been removed from by shaving
a large board on the outside of a building or at the side of the road, used for displaying advertisements
a temporary fence made of boards that is placed around an area of land until a building has been built
the act of collecting and keeping large amounts of food, money, etc., often secretly
being planned; happening
a single tear that comes from your eye
the fact of being extremely unwilling to spend money
the fact of not being willing to give something or enough of something; the fact of not being generous with money
a way of living in which you use only as much money or food as is necessary
the fact of a meal being small and plain and not costing very much
any creature with four feet
the state of not being safe or certain
a state of not having a secure job or income, especially over a long period of time
a small animal from Africa or Asia that eats insects, and has a long nose, tongue and tail, and hard scales on its body
